June 4th, 1933.
Dear
B111, Roberton
811m,
Mr. Ball:
Its two much trouble to write a
personal letter to each of you and I know that none of
you will mind receiving a circular letter.
I am writing this (typewritten copies
to be made for each of you) on board a good old Loening or
flying farm house.
We, are approaching Shanghai after e
grand trip and I'll have time to throw you boys a few
curves before we land.
E.M. Allison Chief Pilot, V.L. Bond
Operations
Manager of Chine National Aviation Corporation,
Mr.
Chapelein
